Reviews.Title: A Great Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: J. Burton
Reviews.Content: While I have only had this Toshiba TV/DVD Combo for only a month, I have found it to be a great value for the money.  The quality and color of the picture is excellent and the sound is very good considering the unit is not intended to be a home entertainment component piece but rather a stand-alone unit for a smaller room.  I bought the set for our kitchen, and it is an excellent addition.  The ability to watch DVD videos related to cooking, baking, and food preparation is a really nice touch.  Although I delayed buying the set because there seem to be so few positive ratings about it online, I decided to take the plunge anyway, and I am certainly glad I did because I have not found any of the more negative issues other reviewers have mentioned.  For the price of this set, I believe it to be an exceptional value, and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Poorly Designed
Reviews.Author: John A,. Jackson
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound are fine.  Channel control is problematic and there is no convenient way to exclude channels.  Out of the box, it sits unlevel.  Apparently, the weight of the DVD player on the left side creates a slight tilt.  The tilt is annoying in the beginning, but you will adjust.I bought the TV in April of 2011.  Unfortunately, I did not try watching a DVD until September, after the return policy has expired.  The DVD player will not read any DVD I try.Toshiba has advised I need to send the TV in for repair, but they do not cover the shipping to their facility.  Shipping will cost more than another DVD player.  So much for warranty.I bought this TV because I have other Toshiba products that I like.  This TV has been a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but power supply is doomed
Reviews.Author: castillet
Reviews.Content: We had this TV for a little over a year. It was installed in the bedroom, so it got some use, but not too much. During that time, the picture quality was good as was the sound. No complaints. However, after about a year it started not turning on. I had it serviced and they told me the power supply was gone. Dead. They said it's pretty common in this Toshiba model and that Toshiba doesn't even make a replacement power supply. Sounds like the manufacture was defective.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but Flawed Base
Reviews.Author: Zeny
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these and they both have the same problem. The Tv is very heavy on the DVD-Drive side and combined with a weak base makes this Tv tilt aprox 3/8" to the left. This appears to be an engineering flaw... someone forgot to take into consideration the weight on the DVD-Drive side.Great Picture, but I would not purchase untill this problem is fixed !

Reviews.Title: It is what is is.
Reviews.Author: gtucker7848
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a week now, and my initial impression is as follows:It is perfect as a secondary TV, either for a bedroom (where I use it), or for an office. I have found it to be exactly as advertised on Amazon, with no obvious defects or surprises. I have noticed none of the negative things stated in other reviews on this site.There are a couple of things I particularly like about this set. First, it has more than sufficient input and output capabilities, especially since you no longer need an external DVD player (note however, that the internal player is for DVD's only, not Blu-ray discs). Additionally, the on board speakers for this set are of quite good quality, and more than sufficient for a secondary TV. Assembly literally took me one minute (and the aid of only a screw driver), and the initial setup is as easy as following a few on screen prompts.On a personal note, I have learned over the years to take online reviews and ratings with a grain of salt. I've found that the majority of negative ratings come from either the buyers lack of technical knowledge, or the buyer not using the product for it's intended use. If your looking for a theater quality TV, with ear shattering audio, internet apps, and the ability to watch your entire home movie collection on 10 different kinds of discs, this is not the TV for you. If, on the other hand, your looking for a basic HDTV, with a functional on board DVD player to reduce clutter, and the ability to hook up your streaming device, TOSHIBA HAS PRODUCED A VIABLE CHOICE!!!Revised on 1-10-2012:After a little over a month of use, this TV went completely out today. Absolutely no warning, it just failed to even turn on. Other reviews mentioned a power supply issue, and I now believe them to be correct. STAY AWAY FROM THIS TV!!!! On a positive note, Amazon paid the shipping for me to return it, no questions asked. I'll be sticking to LG, which I've always had good luck with in the past.

Reviews.Title: Terrible product - don't purchase this
Reviews.Author: Chris Kunselman
Reviews.Content: NOT ONLY IS THE PRODUCT TERRIBLE, SO IS TOSHIBA SUPPORT.  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!!!!  I took a risk. I read all the reviews on this.  Unfortunately, I didn't do a problem search on the product.  There is a power supply issue witht his product and mine failed too.  I am sending it in (at my cost, because that's toshiba's warranty) to be fixed at their cost.  I would not waste money on this product.  I'm stuck with it now.  DO NOT BUY IT! (Samsung TVs are much better)

Reviews.Title: Son's Birthday Gift
Reviews.Author: Bill Onderdonk
Reviews.Content: My son wanted a TV/DVD combo for his birthday so since I got my other 2 children the 22 inch version of this model which is no longer available, I purchased the 24 inch. So far it performs just like the other smaller version which is very well. Before I got the Comcast converter, I connected a small antenna so I could see what true high def. looks like from our local TV channel. Let me tell you that true over the air 1080i is the best you will get over cable or satellite. Unfortunately that was the only channel I picked up so we will be connected to Comcast's standard 480i picture which looks like crap but I refuse to pay the extra money Comcast charges for the better box. My son will be using it mostly to watch movies and play his Xbox anyway. I will agree that the set leans a bit to the left because of the weight but we mounted it to the wall as was planned so that is not an issue. I hope that we do not have any of the other issues that were reported in previous reviews. I would highly recommend this. Oh, as far as LCD/LED. All monitors are LCD (liquid crystal display). The "LED" is the back light used to give you a picture. The older TV's used fluorescent lighting but now they use LEDs for better picture and less energy consumption. Don't get confused as the other writer was. Look it up in Google for yourself.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba flat screen tv
Reviews.Author: Gail Apfel
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying this tv immensely. It was easy to hook up, and easily set up with the cable system I subscribe to. It is just the right size for my space, and is oh so light in weight!

Reviews.Title: Sit directly in front of it and it's fine
Reviews.Author: Tinker
Reviews.Content: We've had this now for a week.  The Boss picked it up at a local BB after the clerk recommended it for a PS3 ONT THE SAME DAY Amazon delivered a 22-inch Samsung I buought for her for the same purpose.I don't like this at all.  The viewing angles are the narrowest I've ever seen an LCD screen produce.  It seems that 10-degrees off of directly in front of the screen and the picture gets so dark you can't really see what's going on, and the drop off is worse if you are more than a couple of degrees above or below it.Yes, directly in front of it and it has a great picture, very crisp with good contrast and great color rendition.But if you squirm around or change positions a lot - like me - it disappoints.UPDATE:  Adding one star.  The narrow viewing angle is only a problem with on-air or satellite standard-definition content.  When playing DVD's or Blu-rays, viewing angle is less of a problem.  It's still too narrow, IMHO, but it's significantly better with HD than non-HD content.

Reviews.Title: No instructions to remove pedestal/neck
Reviews.Author: KarenH
Reviews.Content: I was completely frustrated with this tv and Toshiba.  We wanted to wall mount the tv, but could not remove the pedestal/neck.  I called Toshiba because there are no instructions to remove the neck and they were no help whatsoever.  I was told repeatedly to remove 4 screws from the bottom and then hung up on twice.  These are the instructions in the manual to remove the base of the stand or rectangular part, not the neck, the cylindrical thing that sticks out at the bottom of the tv.The third guy told me to call their service centre in our city.  I called them and they told me I would have to pay for a service technician to make a house call.  Why should I have to pay for a service call?  How can they advertise this tv as wall-mountable and not supply instructions as to how to get the neck off.One of the other reviewers on this site helped me out and wrote how to do it.  I can't tell you how much I appreciated his help.  It was a simple matter of removing 3 screws above the neck and pulling firmly on the neck.  Seems simple, but the neck is quite firmly held in the tv and you really have to tug.  Who knew?As far as the tv is concerned, the picture is okay, the sound is a bit tinny and can't be turned up enough and there is no headphone jack to add speakers, it's nice to have the dvd player, but you cannot hook up an external hard drive and watch stored shows.  It only displays photos - no video.  This is our first flatscreen and I am not too pleased with the choices of the picture ratio.  Either you can set it so that there is a border around or on either side of the whole picture or you can get the picture to fill the whole screen, but it is either cropped or stretched and distorted.  Not Toshiba's fault of course.

Reviews.Title: lasted one week
Reviews.Author: turkishcarpenter
Reviews.Content: One week from purchase date, remote stop working. Called Amazon and they gave me the option either return it or get a replacement. I returned it and got my money back. Great customer service! I was really disappointed with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Consider overlooking some negative reviews
Reviews.Author: SonicSculptor "SonicSculptor"
Reviews.Content: I purchsed just over a week ago.  I can't find any of the problems listed in other reviews.  I left this new on since I got it, nonstop.  I do cycle the power on/off a time or two a day.  I've played a dozen or so DVD movies.  Sound is as good as I would expect.  It IS certainly loud enough.  Usually the audio volume is between 7 and 12.  Maybe 15 if with a fan on in the room.  Some Netflix videos have gotten me up to the 40's. Out of 100.  TV is in a bedroom enviroment.  I personally found that a +6 boost in bass and a -4 cut in treble helped quite a bit IMHO.  However, I will say I think the speakers are on the right rear of the sceen.  I've used the tv on a stand in a corner of the room, and now wall mounted, with no volume issues and unit seems physically balanced.  No problem with tilting.  There is a 1 second or so delay when turning channels with the internal tuner with some, not all, channels.  Scanning through many channels does seem slow. Maybe TV signal dependant?  And for the few who might care, owners manual says it's Video CD (VCD) compatible.Though I was aware before purchase, I wish it had a headphone jack and analog audio out.  Digital optical out is available.  Also, wish it had Dolby Volume compression or equivelant for TV signals.  Dolby audio compression is available for DVD audio. 60hz has it's limitations, but very tolerable at this screen size.Highly recommended. Picture is great.  Sound is good.  Remote is better than some.Tuner is ATSC/NTSC/QAM (Digital/Analog/Cable-unscrambled). Included stand allows screen to tilt up/down.  Delivery was very fast.  EPA power rating of $7 year.  As long as the power supply and overall reliability holds up, Overall, I'm very pleased.  If it dies, I'll update this review.***Update 11-29-12  --All is still perfect.  Couldn't be more pleased.***Update 4-7-13.  Still going strong and used half of every day.  Not a single problem.

Reviews.Title: This TV works Fine!
Reviews.Author: Discerning Shopper "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: Ok, after reading some of the other reviews, I was having buyer's remorse after purchasing one of these Toshiba sets at my local Best Buy.  I hadn't even opened the box yet, and I was contemplating taking it back, but I'm very glad that I didn't!  I wall-mounted my set it the corner of my bedroom ceiling (in a 10' x 10' room).  It fits perfectly above the door and is the largest set that would fit in that space with a built-in dvd player.  I'm happy to report that I like everything about this set.  The sound is way more than adequate (I sometimes have to turn it down to 2 or 1 just to keep it from being too loud during some shows), so this set is plenty loud and the volume can be cranked way up.The viewing angles on this set are also just fine.  I am viewing the screen from below, at an angle, and the image is still bright and clear and not washed out.  The DVD player also works fine, it even reads discs that wouldn't play in my previous dvd player and that I was about to toss out (glad I kept them)!  It has memory play, so it resumes where I left off, even after turning the power off.  I haven't had any dvd's that wouldn't read properly so far!The only thing I didn't like about this set at first was that it didn't keep the "full-screen" aspect ratio that I like to view most programs in.  However, I learned that you just need to go into the setup menu, and under the "theater" setting, there's the option to turn off "auto-format".  For some reason, Toshiba ships this set with "auto format" on, when turning it off makes the picture retain the "full screen" aspect ratio.This is the second lcd tv/dvd combo unit I've owned (the previous was a 20" Insignia set).  I like the Toshiba much better, 4" larger screen that fits in the same space above my doorway, much better dvd player, and a brighter, clearer picture.  If you have any doubts, buy this set from a reputable seller (like Amazon or Best Buy) that offers a return policy, but I highly doubt you'll be taking this Toshiba back if you try it!

Reviews.Title: Quit working after 5 months
Reviews.Author: S. Fitch
Reviews.Content: I thought this TV/DVD combo was great.  Then one day, after owning it for only 5 months, it would not turn on.  The power light would come on and then shut off again.  It is under warranty, but I still have to PAY to ship it to a repair facility.  I won't buy Toshiba again.

Reviews.Title: They're not kidding!
Reviews.Author: Johnbo
Reviews.Content: Like so many of the other reviewers, I could not get a DVD to play.  I tried many, including some brand new ones.  I had to assume the label faces you, as there was nothing in the instructions confirming this.  But it didn't matter which way I put in any DVD, it would say "reading" for about 15 seconds and then spit the DVD back out.  I called customer service who told me to unplug it & try again, which made absolutely no difference.  If so many don't work out of the box, I can't imagine how they would hold up a few years down the road.  I have had 3 Toshiba TV/DVD/VCR combos in the past, and I really liked them.  I still have 2, and after several years (at least 6--I honestly can't remember!), the DVD players are now becoming temperamental.  But I have purchased my last Toshiba anything.  I don't know why I thought I would be lucky, but it was such a great price, I couldn't resist.  I'll know better next time.  Of course I can return it, but it is such a pain in the butt to re-box everything up & head to UPS, etc.  I think Toshiba owes me for ruining my evening!

Reviews.Title: love it!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: electronic geek
Reviews.Content: We all love it and enjoy it, i can't be more happy about it.  The service was excellent and the set up was really easy, can't be more happy about it.

Reviews.Title: Know what you are buying...
Reviews.Author: D. NEVIN ""Doc""
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for our dining room / kitchen area.The sound on this unit was very poor and volume minimal.If you are going to be more than 12 feet away and have any back groundnoise, you will have a hard time hearing what is on. If you turn on theexhaust fan etc. , forget it !The DVD player did not operate at all. Every disc I put in ( all newer movies, no copies )started to "read" and then was ejected.  No error messages etc.  It was just a dud.Picture: If you are going to use an analog input ( non digital cable channels, VHS etc. )you are going to be disappointed.  This is an inherent problem not one of just this unit but,know that in advance.If you use an analog input, you are probably going to be happier wiht a plasma tv.

Reviews.Title: Good set for bedroom or dorm
Reviews.Author: Tn Marcia B
Reviews.Content: I put this set in my bedroom and am very pleased with it in total. Excellent color,definition and crisp sharp picture. The sound leaves something to be desired unless hooked up to added speakers. For a second set is is very good.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Shaun
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Toshiba 24" LED TV/DVD combo 4SLV411U hoping to do away having  to hook upa seperate DVD player. Once home set the TV up easily enoughg but but it would not recognize any of the DVDs we attempted to use. I hooked up our old DVD player to the TV and it worked fine, picture was good but sound was so - so. Called Toshiba support, they advised that the DVD portion was likely defective and offered to help me set up a repair with a service center. Thanked rep and advised it was going to back to the store, after reading other reviews seems that this problem has occurred to others. Will not by another combo unit from Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24SLV411U does NOT play AVI files
Reviews.Author: David Blackwell
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with this heavy, clunky, poorly designed LEDTV. The User Manual (page 62) and Toshiba tech support mislead me into thinking it played avi files.It does not play avi or mpg video files.  You can NOT play your home video files.I would not call this a video player. It only plays commercial DVDs.[...]My old Coby 22TFTLCDTV was better designed, easier to use, lighter and did play avi and mpg files before it's DVD device stopped working.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier.
Reviews.Author: Peggy S. Campbell
Reviews.Content: The build-in DVD player was my reason for purchasing this TV and it is wonderful.  Ordered it through Amazon Prime and it arrived in two days in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: Good picture
Reviews.Author: S. Fiorio
Reviews.Content: I've been pleased with this product. Good color, sound, and DVD works well.  I'm happy I bought it. It's a good value.

Reviews.Title: Great business tool
Reviews.Author: tfreeman
Reviews.Content: My business uses this monitor for trade shows. Just pop in a CD or plug in a flash drive to run a slide show and then you don't even have to worry about not being at the booth the entire time.  Gives freedom to whoever is there that information about our company is still being presented even if we aren't there to talk about it.

Reviews.Title: awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Temple Gordon
Reviews.Content: My daughter had her TV stolen so a replacement was badly needed. We came across this flat screen with a dvd player. She is happy her other one got stolen since this one is so much better.....

Reviews.Title: Toshiba gets it well done.
Reviews.Author: AAAAmerican "We Love God, Family and Country....
Reviews.Content: Having given this to my In Laws they use it in the largest room, where they reside , the master bedroom, and each is over Ninety years of age now.This very functional piece of equipment, a Toshiba 24LV 411 U1080P LED/LCD gets it done well with all the functions in multi/functions.IMHO they do a much better job of running a company than AMAZON does.PLEASE USA Make these again!!

Reviews.Title: Where's the sound
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: The volume is too low. I could barely hear anything unless standing in front of the set. I was sorely disappointed in the product. It's a nice looking unit and easy to use...but I need sound.

Reviews.Title: LED TV
Reviews.Author: suly
Reviews.Content: This product is an excellent item. I'am very pleased with the quality and functionality of this TV, my son is also very happy, because is actually his TV.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value... superior picture.
Reviews.Author: REM
Reviews.Content: This is the third unit I've purchased... wonderful product.  I highly recommend if you're looking for a Flatpanel w/DVD player included

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24" LED HDTV w/DVD
Reviews.Author: btamura
Reviews.Content: Purchase unit for bedroom as a all-in-one.  Opted f/LED technology for energy savings.  Image very good.  Very easy to use f/DVD play.  Cost more than other 24" models w/separate DVD, but small footprint was also criteria.  Would recommend if your needs are similar.

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Content: Okay this tv was a great buy... $299 cant beat that..to bad i had to return it.... cant really adjust the picture...and my biggest complaint was that the sound quality SUCKED!!!BIGG TIME i had it set to 100% and still no loud sound small tv or not... my mp3 speakers was louder than this tv... i give it the worst tv i wasted my time and money with ...

Reviews.Title: So far, So good review
Reviews.Author: R. Powell
Reviews.Content: Greetigns, purchased this Toshiba set at local (Video Only) store. The store prides itself on selling name brands, thus no Wally World units. Went with the additional 2yr warranty for added security.  Installed this set over my bedroom closet doors, looks great thus far.  It was a challenge, picture was not that great w/1080p, a Dish HD cable box fixed clearity. In the wall, ran an 25ft, 24awg HDMI cable to tv set from HDMI HD cable box input. The cable came from cmple/ny amazon for $8. Placed in wall speakers each side of closet doors. Ran an optical cable from tv to amp inside closet, amp sits on upper rack. Installed four electrical outlets inside closet, ran all the wires through one inch pvc pipe. Placed small 8 inch subwoofer inside, running LFE cable to amp, through pvc pipe. Inverted the csi/speco 6.5 speakers so the tweeter is angled down towards the listener.  Speakercraft aim7 three rotates the whole unit, expensive.  Used 50ft 12awg oxygen free copper wire, from ebay $18, Hopefully this dosent sound like a fire hazard, sounds great.  The one inch pvc pipe worked great, all the tv/receiver/subwoofer electrical ends sliped through. Connected, spliced pvc pipe with T's & elbows, looks very clean. Hope this TV last a couple years, cheers.

Reviews.Title: TV for Mom
Reviews.Author: B. Swann
Reviews.Content: Great picture.  Easy to set up.  My mother loves it. It's a little hard for her to see the controls for the DVD player.

Reviews.Title: Not an LED unit
Reviews.Author: SC
Reviews.Content: The Title for this product is mis-leading. This is not an LED unit, just LCD. So it will run warmer and is not the latest tv technology. I'll post more later after we've used it for awhile.SC

Reviews.Title: Don't even think about buying this piece of junk
Reviews.Author: CottageGardener
Reviews.Content: Bought this for use in a workout room - Paid to have it mounted on an expensive tilt-out bracket.Now I'm paying to have it taken down, so I can take it back.Guess what? This isn't a complete television - it's a component.No picture, so we called tech support. After telling the sarcastic, robotic, barely English-speaking rep the situation, he tells us that OF COURSE the TV doesn't work, because we don't have cable and this TV doesn't have an internal something-or-other that would allow it to pick up a station. (Unlike the Sharp TV in the other room, which pulls in lots of stations, just fine, without a single thing being attached other than the power cord.)So, to summarize:  This television will not work unless you buy other components. It might just be a $20 antenna, but that's not the point. Nowhere, on the box, in the manual, in the online support, does it mention anything about the TV lacking the capability to pull in a TV station without an additional part.Back to Sharp.  There will never be another Toshiba product in our house.

ProductInfo.Features:
Built in DVD Player with Video Resolution of 1080p
60Hz DynaLight Dynamic Backlight Control
PC Input (15-pin D-sub) with USB port
Built in DVD Player
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba 24SLV411U 24-Inch 1080p LED-LCD HDTV with Built-in DVD Player, Black (2011 Model)
